S3.T1.caption: Table 1 :  Comparison for LBS 960h between discriminative models with CTC and HMM topologies, using various label posterior and transition scales,  α 𝛼 \alpha  and  β 𝛽 \beta , respectively. In addition to the WER using a 4-gram LM, we also show the time stamp error (TSE) of their alignment with respect to a GMM alignment, the percentage of silence (Si) in HMM and blank (B) in CTC, as well as the average phoneme duration(Phon).

S3.T2.caption: Table 2 :  Similar experiments as explained in  Table   1  for a subset of models using both dev and test sets for SWB 300h.

S3.T3.caption: Table 3 :   ASR performance of factored hybrid HMM (FH) and mRNN-T in terms of WER for LBS960 and SWB300h, on the alignments presented in  Tables   1  and  2 .

S3.T4.caption: Table 4 :   Similar experiments explained in  Table   3  for SWB300.

S4.T5.caption: Table 5 :  Optimal real time factors (RTF), with distinction between the encoder (Enc.) and search for best 40ms factored hybrid (FH) and mRNN-T models, as well as 10ms FH and traditional hybrid-HMM. Reporting the average number of active state (#S) and lexical prefix-trees (#L) hypotheses at each step, together with WERs and the min and max values for the confidence interval.
